original_title: Sri Lanka rupee opens stronger at 328.50/330.00 to the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka rupee opened at 328.50/330.00 in the spot market, stronger from yesterday, dealers said while bond yields opened marginally lower.

The rupee closed at 329.25/50 to the US dollar in the spot market Wednesday. There was moral suasion as well as some dollar sales to stabilize the exchange rate, which is under an ad ho regime that flips from a peg to a float suddenly.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2030 quoted at 14.40/50 percent down from Wednesday’s close at 14.42/48 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2028 quoted at 14.70/85 percent down from yesterday’s 14.75/82 percent
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 quoted at 15.20/30 percent down from yesterday’s 15.20/35 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 quoted at 15.40/50 percent steady from yesterday’s 15.40/45 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 quoted at 15.80/16.10 percent steady from yesterday’s 15.80/16.00 percent.
